meanings.definition: The action or process of keeping financial accounts.
meanings.sent1: Her meticulous accountings of the company's expenses impressed the auditors.
meanings.sent2: The accountant's job involves a lot of detailed accountings to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The accountant's accountings were so precise that even the calculator was impressed.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, accurate accountings are the compass guiding businesses.
meanings.sent5: The accountings of the company's profits and losses were neatly organized in the ledger.

meanings.definition: A statement of money received and paid.
meanings.sent1: The monthly accountings showed a clear overview of the company's financial transactions.
meanings.sent2: She handed in the accountings to the manager for review at the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The accountings revealed a surprising amount spent on office supplies.
meanings.sent4: The accountings acted as a mirror reflecting the company's financial health.
meanings.sent5: The accountant prepared the accountings with utmost care to avoid errors.
